subject: Personal Finance
title: Roman Money and Empire
description: A 60-second lesson on Roman Money and Empire.

hook.text: Rome built roads, aqueducts, and an empire. The denarius coin paid for all of it.

buildup.text: Roman soldiers were paid in denarii. The word 'salary' may trace to salt rations, but coins ruled.

discovery.text: A single currency across a vast empire enabled trade from Britain to Egypt.

twist.text: When emperors debased the denarius by mixing in cheap metals, inflation destroyed confidence.

climax.text: Rome's monetary collapse contributed directly to the fall of the empire.

punchline.text: Cheap coins helped topple an empire.
